channel.title: Java Bug System
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [JDK-8296610] java/net/HttpURLConnection/SetAuthenticator/HTTPSetAuthenticatorTest.java failed with "BindException: Address already in use: connect"
item.description:
The following test failed in the JDK20 CI:

java/net/HttpURLConnection/SetAuthenticator/HTTPSetAuthenticatorTest.java

Here's a snippet from the log file:

Client: Using authenticator #2: 1904158599-11@HTTPTest$HttpTestAuthenticator
Client: FIRST request: http://127.0.0.1:50150/ GET
Server307: Got GET: /
Accept: [*/*]
Connection: [keep-alive]
Host: [127.0.0.1:50150]
User-agent: [Java/20-ea]
Server307: Redirecting to server
Server307: Sent back 307 Location: http://127.0.0.1:50146/
NoAuth Server: Got GET: /
Accept: [*/*]
Connection: [keep-alive]
Host: [127.0.0.1:50146]
User-agent: [Java/20-ea]
Response code: 200
Response body:

Client: NEXT request: http://127.0.0.1:50150/ POST
----------System.err:(85/6239)----------
WARNING: HttpsProxyTunnel is an experimental test class
java.net.BindException: Address already in use: connect

at java.base/sun.nio.ch.Net.connect(Net.java:580)

item.summary: java/net/HttpURLConnection/SetAuthenticator/HTTPSetAuthenticatorTest.java failed with "BindException: Address already in use: connect"

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk17u-dev/pull/2348
Date: 2024-03-28 19:12:51 +0000

Fix request [17u]

I backport this for parity with 17.0.12-oracle.
No risk, only a test change.
Clean backport.
Test passes. SAP nightly testing passed.

Fix request [17u]

I backport this for parity with 17.0.12-oracle.
No risk, only a test change.
Clean backport.
Test passes.

Changeset: 0dce5b81
Author: Daniel Fuchs <dfuchs@openjdk.org>
Date: 2022-12-14 16:39:32 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/commit/0dce5b811d64ac17b9580d6a2d8eca1df70990a1

A pull request was submitted for review.
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk/pull/11634
Date: 2022-12-12 14:50:21 +0000

I don't think this is worth fixing in 20 unless we see more occurrence (there's only one so far). I'm planning to attempt a fix for 21. We might then envisage to backport it if we still see some failure in 20 but none in 21.
This is one of these issues where there's not much that can be done: it's either ephemeral port exhaustion on the machine or concurrent connection limits enforced by the underlying OS.
